                var propertag = {};

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://netdna.bootstrapcdn.com/font-awesome/4.7.0/css/font-awesome.min.css">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://static.tvtropes.org/design/assets/bundle.css?rev=282" />
<script>
                function object(objectId) {
                    if (document.getElementById && document.getElementById(objectId)) {
                        return document.getElementById(objectId);
                    } else if (document.all && document.all(objectId)) {
                        return document.all(objectId);
                    } else if (document.layers && document.layers[objectId]) {
                        return document.layers[objectId];
                    } else {
                        return false;
                    }
                }

                // JAVASCRIPT COOKIES CODE: for getting and setting user viewing preferences
                var cookies = {
                    create: function (name, value, days2expire, path) {
                        var date = new Date();
                        date.setTime(date.getTime() + (days2expire * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000));
                        var expires = date.toUTCString();
                        document.cookie = name + '=' + value + ';' + 'expires=' + expires + ';' + 'path=' + path + ';';
                    },
                    read: function (name) {
                        var cookie_value = "",
                            current_cookie = "",
                            name_expr = name + "=",
                            all_cookies = document.cookie.split(';'),
                            n = all_cookies.length;

                        for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {
                            current_cookie = all_cookies[i].trim();
                            if (current_cookie.indexOf(name_expr) === 0) {
                                cookie_value = current_cookie.substring(name_expr.length, current_cookie.length);
                                break;
                            }
                        }
                        return cookie_value;
                    },
                    update: function (name, val) {
                        this.create(name, val, 300, "/");
                    },
                    remove: function (name) {
                        document.cookie = name + "=; expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT; path=/";
                    }
                };

                function updateUserPrefs() {
                    //GENERAL: detect and set browser, if not cookied (will be treated like a user-preference and added to the #user-pref element)
                    if( !cookies.read('user-browser') ){
                        var broswer = '';

                        if(navigator.userAgent.match(/iPhone/i) || navigator.userAgent.match(/iPod/i) ){
                            browser = 'iOS';
                        } else if (/Opera[\/\s](\d+\.\d+)/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
                            browser = 'opera';
                        } else if (/MSIE (\d+\.\d+);/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
                            browser = 'MSIE';
                        } else if (/Navigator[\/\s](\d+\.\d+)/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
                            browser = 'netscape';
                        } else if (/Chrome[\/\s](\d+\.\d+)/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
                            browser = 'chrome';
                        } else if (/Safari[\/\s](\d+\.\d+)/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
                            browser = 'safari';
                            /Version[\/\s](\d+\.\d+)/.test(navigator.userAgent);
                            browserVersion = new Number(RegExp.$1);
                        } else if (/Firefox[\/\s](\d+\.\d+)/.test(navigator.userAgent)) {
                            browser = 'firefox';
                        } else {
                            browser = 'internet_explorer';
                        }
                        cookies.create('user-browser',browser,1,'/');
                        document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('browser-' + browser);
                    } else {
                        document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('browser-' + cookies.read('user-browser'));
                    }

                    //update user preference settings
                    if (cookies.read('wide-load') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('wide-load');
                    if (cookies.read('night-vision') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('night-vision');
                    if (cookies.read('sticky-header') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('sticky-header');
                    if (cookies.read('show-spoilers') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('show-spoilers');
                    if (cookies.read('folders-open') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('folders-open');
                    if (cookies.read('lefthand-sidebar') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('lefthand-sidebar');
                    if (cookies.read('highlight-links') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('highlight-links');
                    if (cookies.read('forum-gingerbread') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('forum-gingerbread');
                    if (cookies.read('shared-avatars') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('shared-avatars');
                    if (cookies.read('new-search') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('new-search');
                    if (cookies.read('stop-auto-play-video') !== '') document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('stop-auto-play-video');

                    //desktop view on mobile
                    if (cookies.read('desktop-on-mobile') !== ''){
                        document.getElementById('user-prefs').classList.add('desktop-on-mobile');

                        var viewport = document.querySelector("meta[name=viewport]");
                        viewport.setAttribute('content', 'width=1000');
                    }

                }

                function updateDesktopPrefs() {
                    if (cookies.read('wide-load') !== '') document.getElementById('sidebar-toggle-wideload').classList.add('active');
                    if (cookies.read('night-vision') !== '') document.getElementById('sidebar-toggle-nightvision').classList.add('active');
                    if (cookies.read('sticky-header') !== '') document.getElementById('sidebar-toggle-stickyheader').classList.add('active');
                    if (cookies.read('show-spoilers') !== '') document.getElementById('sidebar-toggle-showspoilers').classList.add('active');

                }

                function updateMobilePrefs() {
                    if (cookies.read('show-spoilers') !== '') document.getElementById('mobile-toggle-showspoilers').classList.add('active');
                    if (cookies.read('night-vision') !== '') document.getElementById('mobile-toggle-nightvision').classList.add('active');
                    if (cookies.read('sticky-header') !== '') document.getElementById('mobile-toggle-stickyheader').classList.add('active');
                    if (cookies.read('highlight-links') !== '') document.getElementById('mobile-toggle-highlightlinks').classList.add('active');

                }


                if (document.cookie.indexOf("scroll0=") < 0) {
                    // do nothing
                } else {
                    console.log('ads removed by scroll.com');
                    var adsRemovedWith = 'scroll';
                    var style = document.createElement('style');
                    style.innerHTML = '#header-ad, .proper-ad-unit, .square_ad, .sb-ad-unit { display: none !important; } ';
                    document.head.appendChild(style);
                }
            </script>
</head>
<body class="">
<i id="user-prefs"></i>
<script>updateUserPrefs();</script>

<h1 itemprop="headline" class="entry-title">
<strong>Literature / </strong>
1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die
</h1>
<a href="#mobile-actions-toggle" id="mobile-actionbar-toggle" class="mobile-actionbar-toggle mobile-on" data-click-toggle="active">

</nav>
<div id="main-article" class="article-content retro-folders">
<p><em>1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die</em> is a book about movies supervised by Steven Jay Schneider. It contains a list of movies that are considered "must-see" movies, with each entry accompanied by a short essay explaining why. It was first published in 2003, with new editions having been released annually since then. Because of these updates, there have been more than 1001 movies in total in it (but always 1001 in any given edition, as there are the same number of entries added as removed each edition). As of the 2019 edition, a total of 1222 movies have been included in the English-language version. The book has also been translated to several other languages, and those editions replace some of the entries with local films (Swedish films in the Swedish edition, and so on).</p><div class="proper-ad-unit mobile-ad square_ad"><h6 class="ad-caption">Advertisement:</h6><div id="proper-ad-tvtropes_content_3"><script>propertag.cmd.push(function() { proper_display('tvtropes_content_3'); })</script></div></div><p>The book eschews <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueArtIsAngsty" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueArtIsAngsty">True Art Is Angsty</a> and <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueArtIsIncomprehensible" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueArtIsIncomprehensible">True Art Is Incomprehensible</a>, featuring films like <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Babe" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Babe">Babe</a></em> and <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ThePrincessBride" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ThePrincessBride">The Princess Bride</a></em> alongside the likes of <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UnChienAndalou" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UnChienAndalou">Un Chien Andalou</a></em>, <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Persona" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Persona">Persona</a></em>, and <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/DancerInTheDark" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/DancerInTheDark">Dancer in the Dark</a></em>. As the introduction notes, a comprehensive overview of film history does not only contain one type of movie, but all kinds &#150; epics, documentaries, cult films, blockbusters, experimental films, and slapstick comedies. The book also does not aim to contain the 1001 <em>best</em> movies, but 1001 "must-see" movies. To that end, the selection has been made with care taken to ensure that it includes the entire panorama of film history, with films from all eras, regions, and genres.</p><p>Treating the book as a cinematic bucket list as the title suggests has become fairly common for cinephiles. There is a <a class="urllink" href="https://www.listchallenges.com/1001-movies-you-must-see-before-you-die-all/">List Challenge with over 50&nbsp;000 users<img src="https://static.tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pub/external_link.gif" height="12" width="12" style="border:none;"></a>, a <a class="urllink" href="https://1001films.fandom.com/wiki/1001_Movies_You_Must_See_Before_You_Die_Wiki">wiki<img src="https://static.tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pub/external_link.gif" height="12" width="12" style="border:none;"></a>, a <a class="urllink" href="https://old.reddit.com/r/1001Movies/">subreddit<img src="https://static.tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pub/external_link.gif" height="12" width="12" style="border:none;"></a>, innumerable <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Website/IMDb" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Website/IMDb">IMDb</a> lists, and a bunch of other places online, all dedicated to the list and watching all the movies on it.</p><div class="proper-ad-unit mobile-ad square_ad"><h6 class="ad-caption">Advertisement:</h6><div id="proper-ad-tvtropes_content_2"><script>propertag.cmd.push(function() { proper_display('tvtropes_content_2'); })</script></div></div><hr><div class="folderlabel" Awful Truth</a></em> (1937)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Babe" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Babe">Babe</a></em> (1995)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UnderTheSkin" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UnderTheSkin">Under the Skin</a></em> (2013)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Underground" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Underground">Underground</a></em> (1995)</li><li> <em><a class="createlink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UneAffaireDeFemmes" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UneAffaireDeFemmes">Une Affaire De Femmes</a></em> (1988)</li><li> <em><a class="createlink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UneHistoireDeVent" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/UneHistoireDeVent">Une Histoire De Vent</a></em> (1988)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Unforgiven" 93</a></em> (2006)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheUnknown" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheUnknown">The Unknown</a></em> (1927)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" <em>Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios</em>) (1988)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Woodstock" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Woodstock">Woodstock</a></em> (1970)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/WRMysteriesOfTheOrganism" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/WRMysteriesOfTheOrganism">W.R.: Mysteries of the Organism</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>W.R. - Misterije organizma</em>) (1971)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheWrestler" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheWrestler">The Wrestler</a></em> (2008)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/WrittenOnTheWind" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/WrittenOnTheWind">Written on the Wind</a></em> (1956)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheWrongMan" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheWrongMan">The Wrong Man</a></em> (1956)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/WutheringHeights" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/WutheringHeights">Wuthering Heights</a></em> (1939)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YTuMamaTambien" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YTuMamaTambien">Y Tu Mam&aacute; Tambi&eacute;n</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>And Your Mother, Too</em>) (2001)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YankeeDoodleDandy" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YankeeDoodleDandy">Yankee Doodle Dandy</a></em> (1942)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Yeelen" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Yeelen">Yeelen</a></em> (1987)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YiYi" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YiYi">Yi Yi</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>A One and a Two</em>) (2000)</li><li> <em><a class="createlink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Yol" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Yol">Yol</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>The Way</em>) (1982)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YoungFrankenstein" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/YoungFrankenstein">Young Frankenstein</a></em> (1974)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheYoungGirlsOfRochefort" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheYoungGirlsOfRochefort">The Young Girls of Rochefort</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>Les demoiselles de Rochefort</em>) (1967)</li><li> <em><a class="createlink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheYoungOne" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheYoungOne">The Young One</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>La joven</em>) (1960)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Z" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Z">Z</a></em> (1969)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZabriskiePoint" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZabriskiePoint">Zabriskie Point</a></em> (1970)</li><li> <em><a class="createlink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZangikuMonogatari" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZangikuMonogatari">Zangiku Monogatari</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>The Story of the Last Chrysanthemum</em>) (1939)</li><li> <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZeroForConduct" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZeroForConduct">Zero for Conduct</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>Zero de conduite</em>) (1933)</li><li> <em><a class="createlink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZeroKelvin" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ZeroKelvin">Zero Kelvin</a></em> (a.k.a. <em>Kj&aelig;rlighetens kj&oslash;tere</em>) (1995)</li></ul></div><h2>The book provides examples of:</h2><ul><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimationAgeGhetto" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimationAgeGhetto">Animation Age Ghetto</a>: <span style="display:none">invoked</span> Argued as the reason why, in later editions, the <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/WesternAnimation/ToyStory" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/WesternAnimation/ToyStory">Toy Story</a></em> trilogy only received one entry to cover all three movies whereas every movie of original <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/StarWars" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/StarWars">Star Wars</a></em> trilogy each got its own entry. Out of the 1222 films that have been included (as of the 2019 edition), only 20 (1.6%) have been animated.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CulturalTranslation" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CulturalTranslation">Cultural Translation</a>: Translated editions of the book replace a certain number of entries with local entries. The Swedish edition contains movies such as <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Theatre/MissJulie" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Theatre/MissJulie">Miss Julie</a></em>, <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/JagArNyfiken" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/JagArNyfiken">Jag &auml;r nyfiken</a></em>, and <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ShowMeLove" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/ShowMeLove">Show Me Love</a></em> that aren't in the original English-language edition, for instance.</li><div class="proper-ad-unit mobile-ad square_ad"><h6 class="ad-caption">Advertisement:</h6><div id="proper-ad-tvtropes_content_1"><script>propertag.cmd.push(function() { proper_display('tvtropes_content_1'); })</script></div></div><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Doorstopper" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Doorstopper">Doorstopper</a>: The book is is 960 pages long, and the total number of pages of content is even greater due to the annual updates.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin">Exactly What It Says on the Tin</a>: The book contains a list of 1001 movies (well, kind of &#150; see <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverTrustATitle" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverTrustATitle">Never Trust a Title</a>) the author considers must-see movies, with each entry accompanied by a short essay explaining why.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FunetikAksent" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FunetikAksent">Funetik Aksent</a>: The entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Dracula1931" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Dracula1931">Dracula</a></em> renders <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/BelaLugosi" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/BelaLugosi">Bela Lugosi</a>'s lines as "Cheeldren of the naight, leesten to thaim" and "I nevair dreenk vine!".</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsNotPornItsArt" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsNotPornItsArt">It's Not Porn, It's Art</a>: The introduction notes that the book aims to include the entire panorama of film history, with films from all eras, regions, and genres. However, pornographic films are conspicuously absent (even though there are some pornographic films that could be argued to be important in film history), and the entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/InTheRealmOfTheSenses" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/InTheRealmOfTheSenses">In the Realm of the Senses</a></em> (a film with unsimulated sex scenes) explicitly refers to it as a non-pornographic film.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongTitle" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongTitle">Long Title</a>: For this reason, the title is often abbreviated to simply <em>1001 Movies</em> when the book is discussed.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverTrustATitle" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverTrustATitle">Never Trust a Title</a>: The book does not contain exactly 1001 movies, but 1001 <em>entries</em>&mdash;<em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Olympia" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Olympia">Olympia</a></em> parts 1 and 2 are combined in a single entry, as are the two parts of <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/IvanTheTerrible" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/IvanTheTerrible">Ivan the Terrible</a></em>, the three films in <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheLordOfTheRings" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheLordOfTheRings">The Lord of the Rings</a></em> trilogy, and the first three <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/WesternAnimation/ToyStory" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/WesternAnimation/ToyStory">Toy Story</a></em> films. Moreover, two of the entries are <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/KrzysztofKieslowski" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/KrzysztofKieslowski">Krzysztof Kie&#347;lowski</a>'s <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheDecalogue" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheDecalogue">The Decalogue</a></em> (a 10-episode miniseries) and <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/LarsVonTrier" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/LarsVonTrier">Lars von Trier</a>'s <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Series/Riget" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Series/Riget">Riget</a></em> (an 8-episode, 2-season TV series), which are not movies to begin with. In addition, the book is updated annually (and has been since 2003), with the total number of works included numbering 1222 as of the 2019 edition.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReferenceOverdosed" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReferenceOverdosed">Reference Overdosed</a>: The essays motivating the films' inclusion in the book, written by over 50 different film critics, often make heavy use of references and parallels to other films, directors, scriptwriters, et cetera to make their point. The half-page entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheSaragossaManuscript" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheSaragossaManuscript">The Saragossa Manuscript</a></em>, for instance, references <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/JamesDean" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/JamesDean">James Dean</a>, <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/ArabianNights" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/ArabianNights">Arabian Nights</a></em>, <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/FranzKafka" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/FranzKafka">Franz Kafka</a>, and <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/RomanPolanski" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/RomanPolanski">Roman Polanski</a>.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScareQuotes" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScareQuotes">Scare Quotes</a>: The entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Ran" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/Ran">Ran</a></em> refers to its runtime as a "mere" two hours and forty minutes.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeinfeldIsUnfunny" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeinfeldIsUnfunny">"Seinfeld" Is Unfunny</a>: <span style="display:none">invoked</span> The entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheSoundOfMusic" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheSoundOfMusic">The Sound of Music</a></em> notes that while the opening scene may seem banal nowadays, that's only because it has been imitated so much.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeThat" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeThat">Take That!</a>: The entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/PlanetOfTheApes1968" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/PlanetOfTheApes1968">Planet of the Apes</a></em> says that it was a project that could have gone horribly wrong, and points to <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/PlanetOfTheApes2001" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/PlanetOfTheApes2001">the 2001 remake</a> as an example of how.</li><li> <a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeThatAudience" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeThatAudience">Take That, Audience!</a>: The entry for <em><a class="twikilink" href="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/JohnnyGuitar" title="/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/JohnnyGuitar">Johnny Guitar</a></em> says that if that film is not to one's liking, perhaps one is better off only watching documentaries.</li></ul><hr>
</div>
<div class="square_ad footer-article-ad">
<div class='proper-ad-unit '>
<div id='proper-ad-tvtropes_main_2'> <script>propertag.cmd.push(function() { proper_display('tvtropes_main_2'); });</script> </div>
</div> </div>
<div class="section-links" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/SiteNavigationElement">

</article>

<p class="community-showcase">

<img src="https://static.tvtropes.org/images/communityShowcase-echochamber.jpg" alt=""></a>

<script type="text/javascript">
  (function(i,s,o,g,r,a,m){i['GoogleAnalyticsObject']=r;i[r]=i[r]||function(){
  (i[r].q=i[r].q||[]).push(arguments)},i[r].l=1*new Date();a=s.createElement(o),
  m=s.getElementsByTagName(o)[0];a.async=1;a.src=g;m.parentNode.insertBefore(a,m)
  })(window,document,'script','//www.google-analytics.com/analytics.js','ga');

  ga('create', 'UA-3821842-1', 'auto');
  ga('send', 'pageview');

</script>
<script type="text/javascript">
      function send_analytics_event(user_type, donation){
          // if(user_type == 'uncached' || user_type == 'cached'){
          //   ga('send', 'event', 'caching', 'load', user_type, {'nonInteraction': 1});
          //   return;
          // }
          var event_name = user_type;

          if(donation == 'true'){
              event_name += "_donation"
          }else if(typeof(valid_user) == 'undefined'){
              event_name += "_blocked"
          }else if(valid_user == true){
              event_name += "_unblocked";
          }else{
              event_name = "_unknown"
          }
          ga('send', 'event', 'ads', 'load', event_name, {'nonInteraction': 1});
      }

    
    send_analytics_event("guest", "false");
    
  </script>
</body>
</html>
